thread.title: Here’s How Korea Is Reacting To Park Geun Hye’s Removal From Office
thread.title_full: Here’s How Korea Is Reacting To Park Geun Hye’s Removal From Office

author: jun2yng
title: Here’s How Korea Is Reacting To Park Geun Hye’s Removal From Office
text:
March 10, 2017, history was made in South Korea as Park Geun Hye — also the nation’s first female president — became the first Korean president to be impeached and removed from office . After months of peaceful protest in the country, celebration abounds. Here is how Koreans are reacting to the news: The solidarity continues: 
— SeungJu Seo (@Suit_RZ) March 10, 2017 “Park Geun Hye (66, unemployed)” 
— 흐린안개형 사에군 (@ChildrenSirloin) March 10, 2017 When Trump’s words were kind of useful: 
“Go home and get a job! Go home! Get a job! Get a job!” 
— 흐린안개형 사에군 (@ChildrenSirloin) March 10, 2017 Kind of useful, part 2: 
“You’re FIRED.” Dreams really do come true: 
“I had a dream, and Park Geun Hye had been impeached and was in prison. She had lost all color in her hair and it was all white. Is this a crap dream? TT March 13, 2013 ” 
(in the picture below, behind Park Geun Hye) “A country where my dreams come true.” 
(below picture) “Yup, a country where your dreams come true.” 
— Atsui @사븜 28/840… (@_Atsui_P) March 10, 2017 Justice literally rolling in. 
Chief justice Lee Jung Mi was seen rolling in to the Constitutional Court on Friday in rollers. 
YASS.
